seo.title: Investment Strategies | diBoaS
seo.description: 10 strategies. Different goals. Different timelines. Different risk levels. Find the strategy that fits your life.

hero.headline: Find the strategy that fits your life
hero.subheadline: 10 strategies. Different goals. Different timelines. Different risk levels.
hero.subheadline2: No strategy is "best." The best one is the one that matches where you are and where you're going.
hero.trustLine: All strategies use solid systems that have secured billions for years. We tested them across 4 years of real market data — bull and bear markets, crashes and recoveries, and everything in between.

matrix.instructions: Pick your goal on the left. Then decide: stable returns only, or open to growth potential?
matrix.note: Not sure? Start with Safe Harbor. It's designed for people who want to learn how this works before committing more. You can always switch later.

safeHarbor.name: Safe Harbor
safeHarbor.tagline: Your safety net that actually grows
safeHarbor.description: This is where you keep money you might need tomorrow. It needs to be there when you need it. No surprises.
safeHarbor.description2: Safe Harbor uses only stable digital dollars. No exposure to digital asset prices. Your $1,000 stays close to $1,000 while earning returns.
safeHarbor.allocation: 50% System A + 30% System B + 20% System C
safeHarbor.allocationNote: Your money is distributed across multiple independent systems to reduce risk.

stats.bumpiness: Very smooth. Your balance stayed stable throughout our 4-year test.

safeHarbor.bestFor: People building their first emergency fund. Anyone who wants to learn how this works without price swings.
safeHarbor.riskLevel: Minimal — Your balance stays stable. The only risk is technical issues with the underlying systems, which have operated safely for years.

stableGrowth.name: Stable Growth
stableGrowth.description: Same purpose as Safe Harbor, but with 30% exposure to digital asset growth. You're accepting some price movement for higher potential returns.
stableGrowth.description2: This works for people who already have a stable emergency fund and want their second layer to work harder.

stats.bumpiness: Some waves. At worst, your balance temporarily dropped 8% before recovering.

stableGrowth.bestFor: People comfortable with some price movement who want their safety net to capture growth potential.
stableGrowth.riskLevel: Low — 30% of your balance will move with digital asset prices.
stableGrowth.note: Not for your primary emergency fund. Build Safe Harbor first.

goalKeeper.name: Goal Keeper
goalKeeper.description: Saving for something in the next 2 years? A trip, a wedding, a car? This keeps every euro working toward your deadline without risking it.
goalKeeper.allocation: 60% System A + 25% System B + 15% System C
goalKeeper.bestFor: Anyone with a specific goal and timeline under 2 years.
goalKeeper.riskLevel: Minimal — Designed for capital preservation with steady returns.

steadyProgress.name: Steady Progress
steadyProgress.description: You have a goal in the next 2 years, but you're okay with some price movement if it means higher returns.

stats.bumpiness: Moderate waves. At worst, your balance temporarily dropped 11% before recovering.

steadyProgress.bestFor: People saving for a goal who can handle seeing their balance dip temporarily.
steadyProgress.riskLevel: Low-Medium — Your balance will move with digital asset prices.

patientBuilder.name: Patient Builder
patientBuilder.tagline: Steady growth for the patient investor
patientBuilder.description: You're thinking 2-5 years out. Maybe a down payment, maybe starting a business.
patientBuilder.allocation: 50% System A + 30% System B + 20% System C
patientBuilder.bestFor: Medium-term savers who prioritize predictability over maximum returns.
patientBuilder.riskLevel: Minimal — Same stable profile, optimized for longer holding.

balancedBuilder.name: Balanced Builder
balancedBuilder.description: Most of your money stays safe. Some captures digital asset growth. This is our most popular strategy for people with 3-5 year horizons.
balancedBuilder.allocation: 60% System A + 25% System D + 15% System E

stats.bumpiness: Moderate waves. At worst, your balance temporarily dropped 13% before recovering.

balancedBuilder.bestFor: People who understand that prices go up AND down, and can hold through temporary dips.
balancedBuilder.riskLevel: Medium — 40% growth exposure means meaningful swings in both directions.

steadyCompounder.name: Steady Compounder
steadyCompounder.tagline: Let time do the heavy lifting
steadyCompounder.description: You're playing the long game. 5-10 years. You don't need to take big risks because you have time on your side.
steadyCompounder.allocation: 55% System A + 30% System B + 15% System C
steadyCompounder.bestFor: Long-term savers who want peace of mind over maximum returns.
steadyCompounder.riskLevel: Minimal — Slow and steady wins the race.

wealthAccelerator.name: Wealth Accelerator
wealthAccelerator.tagline: For believers who've done the research
wealthAccelerator.description: This is not for everyone. 70% growth exposure means your portfolio will move significantly with digital asset prices.
wealthAccelerator.allocation: 30% System A + 35% System D + 35% System E

stats.typicalReturn: Highly variable — could be negative or exceed 50%
stats.bumpiness: Big swings. At worst, your balance dropped 47% before recovering.

wealthAccelerator.bestFor: Long-term believers who can stomach extreme volatility for potentially higher returns.
wealthAccelerator.riskLevel: High — Significant chance of meaningful losses in shorter timeframes.
wealthAccelerator.warning: Your outcomes could range from -60% to +200%+. Only for users who can tolerate significant losses.

yieldMaximizer.name: Yield Maximizer
yieldMaximizer.description: You want the highest stable returns over 10+ years without exposure to digital asset prices.
yieldMaximizer.allocation: 45% System A + 35% System B + 20% System C
yieldMaximizer.bestFor: Conservative long-term wealth builders who want strong returns without price swings.

fullThrottle.name: Full Throttle
fullThrottle.description: This is our most aggressive strategy. 85% growth exposure. Designed for a small portion of your portfolio that you're willing to lose entirely.
fullThrottle.allocation: 15% System A + 30% System D + 35% System E + 20% System F

stats.typicalReturn: Extremely variable — from large losses to extraordinary gains
stats.bumpiness: Roller coaster. At worst, your balance dropped 66% before recovering.

fullThrottle.bestFor: Experienced investors with high risk tolerance allocating a small portion of their portfolio.
fullThrottle.riskLevel: Very High — Near-total loss possible. Only use what you can afford to lose completely.
fullThrottle.warning: This isn't safe. It's for those who understand that. You could lose 78% or gain extraordinarily. Never put money here that you need.

options.emergency: Emergency fund → Safe Harbor or Stable Growth
options.shortTerm: Something in the next 2 years → Goal Keeper or Steady Progress
options.mediumTerm: Something in 2-5 years → Patient Builder or Balanced Builder
options.longTerm: Long-term wealth → Steady Compounder, Wealth Accelerator, Yield Maximizer, or Full Throttle

question2.title: How do you feel about price swings?

options.none: "I don't want any" → Stick to the Stable Returns column
options.understand: "I understand them and can wait out dips" → Consider the Growth Potential column
options.unsure: "I'm not sure" → Start stable. Learn. You can always add growth exposure later.

question3.title: What would you do if your balance dropped 20%?

options.panic: "I'd panic and withdraw" → Stable Returns strategies only
options.wait: "I'd wait for it to recover" → Low-medium growth strategies
options.addMore: "I'd add more money" → You might be ready for higher growth exposure

howToChoose.goldenRule: When in doubt, start conservative. You can always move up the risk spectrum. You can't undo losses from strategies you weren't ready for.

switch.question: Can I switch strategies?
switch.answer:
Yes, anytime. No penalties. No questions asked.

Here's something to keep in mind though: if you switch during a market dip, you might lock in a temporary loss.

The best time to switch is when your GOALS change, not when the market moves.

multiple.question: Can I use multiple strategies at once?
multiple.answer:
Absolutely. Many people do.

Think of it like having different accounts for different purposes:
- Emergency fund in Safe Harbor
- Vacation savings in Goal Keeper
- Long-term wealth in Balanced Builder

rebalancing.question: How does rebalancing work?
rebalancing.answer:
When market movements push your allocation off target (more than 10% drift), we'll notify you.

You'll see exactly what changed and why. Then you decide: approve the rebalance, or leave it as is.

We never move your money without your approval.

guaranteed.question: Are these returns guaranteed?
guaranteed.answer:
No. And anyone who guarantees returns is lying to you.

What we can tell you:
- We tested every strategy across 4 years of real market data
- The numbers we show are based on what actually happened and thousands of simulations

Start with what you can afford to learn with.

systemProblem.question: What if one of the systems has a problem?
systemProblem.answer:
This is a real risk. Automated systems are built on code, and code can have vulnerabilities.

We reduce this risk by:
- Only using systems that have secured $10B+ for years
- Spreading your money across multiple independent systems
- Monitoring for unusual activity 24/7

fullThrottleReqs.question: Why are there extra requirements for Full Throttle?
fullThrottleReqs.answer:
Because we want to protect you from yourself.

Full Throttle can lose most of its value. The requirements aren't there to exclude you. They're there to make sure you've thought it through.

whatSystems.question: What systems do you actually use?
whatSystems.answer:
We partner with established systems that have operated for years without major security incidents, secured billions of dollars, and been audited by independent security firms.

Once you join and log in, you'll see the full details of each system.

footer.disclaimer: All performance data is based on historical analysis (May 2022 - December 2025) and thousands of simulations. Past performance does not guarantee future results. Your money is placed in automated systems that carry technical risk, market risk, and liquidity risk. Growth strategies involve additional price volatility risk. Only use money you can afford to lose. diBoaS is not a bank and your funds are not insured.
